name: fireplug
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a large pipe in the street that firefighters can get water from to use to stop fires from burning: He opened the valve of a nearby fireplug, led out the fire hose and directed a heavy stream of water into the fire. Sosa is built as solidly and low to the ground as a fireplug. Synonym
fire hydrant
Don Farrall/Photodisc/GettyImages
someone, especially a man, who is is fairly short and has a slightly heavy and usually strong-looking body: He is a feisty little fireplug of a man.
More examplesFewer examplesHe was 25 years old and built like a fireplug.In 1889, he claimed that the city's fire plugs admitted sewerage and typhoid bacilli into the domestic water supply.A fireplug of a man with his short stature and muscular body, he can seem welcoming and intimidating at the same time.
